definition: to peel with a knife/to pare/to cut (a ball at tennis etc)

sentences.english: Q. But you didn't use the slice a lot tonight.
sentences.chinese: 可你今晚沒用多少削球。

sentences.english: It takes excellent technical skills to play back a slice aggressively.
sentences.chinese: 要打出有攻擊性的削球需要有很優秀的技巧。

sentences.english: Because of his slice, it always gets him back in the rallies .
sentences.chinese: 他的削球總是能讓他及時回位。

sentences.english: Q. Berdych was having some problem with your slice and change of speed.
sentences.chinese: 貝爾蒂奇對你的削球和速度變化束手無策。

sentences.english: In advanced table tennis we often see player hit the ball from below the table.
sentences.chinese: 削球在乒乓球和網球比賽中是很常見的擊球技術之一。

sentences.english: You didn't use the slice a lot.
Pay attention to his backhand chop.
The all-round chop is a developmental trend of this method.
sentences.chinese: 全面型的削球打法是削球發展的趨勢。

sentences.english: The all-round chop is a developmental trend of this method.
sentences.chinese: 全面型的削球打法是削球發展的趨勢。

sentences.english: That is a nice device for sharpening logs.
sentences.chinese: 削球不會困擾一個好的網球選手。

sentences.english: A chip is a soft shot usually used against an opponent who is at the net.
sentences.chinese: 削球指輕輕的一球，通常用來對付靠網的對手。

definition: to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
to serve the ball/to tee off
to intercept at the net (volleyball, tennis etc)/to block
